update.description:
Allow customizing odometry publish frequency and use sim time to throttle. Still defaults to 50Hz.

Try:

`ign gazebo -v 4 diff_drive.sdf`

The blue vehicle should be publishing at 1Hz:

`ign topic -e -t /model/vehicle_blue/odometry`

The green vehicle at 50 Hz:

`ign topic -e -t /model/vehicle_green/odometry`
update.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

pull_request.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

pullrequest.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

content.raw: Well spotted! This PR hasn't touched that logic, and the test was already [flaky](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1948/testReport/junit/(root)/ServerRepeat_DiffDriveTest/PublishCmd_0/history/) on homebrew. We should be able to improve it here though. We probably need to compare `poses[3980]` to `odomPoses[149]` to take the frequency into account (`3980 = 1000 + 149 * 20`)
content.html: Well spotted! This PR hasn't touched that logic, and the test was already flaky on homebrew. We should be able to improve it here though. We probably need to compare poses[3980] to odomPoses[149] to take the frequency into account (3980 = 1000 + 149 * 20)

pull_request.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

pullrequest.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

content.html: @Louise Poubel @Addisu Z. Taddese any suggestions?

pull_request.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

pullrequest.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

content.raw: `poses.end()` points to position after the last element so [test](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1948/testReport/junit/(root)/ServerRepeat_DiffDriveTest/PublishCmd_0/) fails. However, I tried changing `end()` to `back()` but found out that there are still differences in the X and Y odom values
content.html: poses.end() points to position after the last element so test fails. However, I tried changing end() to back() but found out that there are still differences in the X and Y odom values

pull_request.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

pullrequest.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

content.raw: On second thought, how about defaulting to 50 if the parameter is missing, but unthrottled if set to `<= 0`?
content.html: On second thought, how about defaulting to 50 if the parameter is missing, but unthrottled if set to <= 0?

pull_request.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

pullrequest.title: Custom odom frequency in sim time

content.raw: Yeah, the pose publisher system interprets `<= 0` to mean unthrottled. It would be nice to be consistent, but I understand that would not be backward compatible.
content.html: Yeah, the pose publisher system interprets <= 0 to mean unthrottled. It would be nice to be consistent, but I understand that would not be backward compatible.

content.raw: How about inverting this logic, and put the message generation and publication inside the `if` body. It would be easy for a future developer to add something after the publish that shouldn't be throttled.
